items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Coly, River Yarty, Umborne Brook

items.message: River levels are now returning to normal and are below levels of concern. The risk of showery rain is decreasing and not currently expected to cause any further concerns.

This Flood Alert has been removed. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. Occasional showery rainfall is forecast for Tuesday, 29/06/2021, though conditions should be mainly dry. We continue to monitor the situation. Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

items.description: River Kennet and its tributaries from Berwick Bassett down to Newbury

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Kennet, River Og, River Aldbourne, Froxfield Stream, River Dun, River Shalbourne

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high but are beginning to fall on the River Kennet. Therefore, the risk of flooding of low lying roads and farmland remains, especially in the Knighton area. 
No further rainfall is forecast until Friday and over the weekend. We expect river levels to remain high, but continue to fall, over the next few days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels, avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.  
This message will be updated tomorrow, 01/07/2021, or earlier if the situation changes.

The water level in the Eastern Yar remains high, but at Alverstone, it is now falling, currently at a rate of 2 cm per hour. At Sandown, the river has peaked and the level is stable, though it should begin to fall this morning (Wednesday 30/06/21). Today, the weather will remain dry, which will give water levels a good chance to recover. Some flood impacts to gardens and roads are expected to continue, though this will improve throughout the day. Tomorrow (Thursday 01/07/21) and Friday (02/07/21) further heavy showers are possible across Hampshire and the Isle of Wight. Given how sensitive the river will be to further rainfall, these showers will be monitored closely. Tomorrow, depending on the updated weather forecast assessment, we may look to remove this Flood Alert. However, we would still like residents to remain prepared for potential further flood impacts this week. This message will be updated or removed by 12:00 on Thursday 01/07/21.

The Western Rother at Lodsbridge and Fittleworth is falling from the elevated level that it reached after Monday’s heavy rain. It will be back closer to its normal level by early evening today, Tuesday 29 June 2021, following a largely rain-free morning. A small amount of rain is possible today Tuesday 29/6/2021 but this will not be significant and the overall forecast is for dry days Wednesday to Friday. At Iping, Stedham and Midhurst river levels have already fallen back down towards their level before Monday’s heavy rain and will fall further today. We will continue to monitor the levels and the forecast and take operational actions where required.

items.description: Rivers on the Isle of Sheppey
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the level expected to cause flooding.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  No further heavy rainfall is forecast for today, 30/06/2021. Please seek specialist advice before cleaning or repairing after flood damage.
